comment.author: 7354134@N07
comment._content: It was very much Queen Victoria's early look and hairstyle. Pulled back out of the way to deal with all the kids.

comment.author: 8040300@N05
comment._content: These were the days where a woman's hair was her glory. They rarely got it cut in their lifetime. Since it wasn't washed but once in a great while compared to today's standards, it was often put up or tucked away behind bonnets and hats or day caps. Part of the high fashion of the time were hats that sat on top of the head - (See below for a picture) en.wikipedia.org/wiki/1850s_in_fashion en.wikipedia.org/wiki/File:1859-Gazette-Fashions-plate-se... but the hair could not be piled on top. So, to show off your glorious hair, and your hat, you had to pile it around the sides (over your ears) and the back.
